greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Least previously nonoccurring positive integer such that partial sum + 2 is prime.
comment: The sequence is the union of {1} and a permutation of even positive integers. The corresponding partial sums + 1 are 3, 5, 11, 19, 23, 37, 47, 59, 79, 97, 113, 137, 163, 191, 223. See A084758. - _Zak Seidov_, Feb 10 2015
Or, first differences of A084758. - _Zak Seidov_, Feb 10 2015
link: Chai Wah Wu, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: a(n) = MIN{k>0 such that 2 + k + SUM[i=1..n-1]a(i) is prime and k <> a(i)}.
maple: M:= 300: # to get all entries before the first entry > N
for n from 2 while found do
mathematica: f[s_] := Append[s, k = 1; p = 2 + Plus @@ s; While[MemberQ[s, k] || ! PrimeQ[p + k], k++ ]; k]; Nest[f, {}, 67] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 31 2006 *)
results.author: _Jonathan Vos Post_, Aug 30 2006
ext: More terms from _Robert G. Wilson v_, Aug 31 2006
